definition.name: Create secret in Kubernetes cluster
definition.description: Create a generic secret, docker-registry secret, or TLS secret in a Kubernetes such as Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) clusters
definition.author: azure

inputs.name: namespace
inputs.description: Choose the target Kubernetes namespace. If the namespace is not provided, the commands will run in the default namespace.

inputs.name: secret-type
inputs.description: Type of Kubernetes secret. Defaults to 'kubernetes.io/dockerconfigjson'.

inputs.name: secret-name
inputs.description: Name of the secret. You can use this secret name in the Kubernetes YAML configuration file.

inputs.name: container-registry-email
inputs.description: Container Registry email (optional even when using url,username,password)

inputs.name: string-data
inputs.description: JSON object with plaintext string data for secret ex: {"key1":"value1"}

inputs.name: data
inputs.description: JSON object with the serialized form of the secret data in a base64 encoded string ex: {"key1":"[base64 encoded data]"}

inputs.name: tls-key
inputs.description: Base64 encoded TLS private key (PEM format)
